codeandchords

Class Melody

  • java.lang.Object
    • codeandchords.Melody
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Melody
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    06/12/2017 Class to create a melody of Notes and play it by calling Instrument's play(Note) method with them at the appropriate time.
    Author:
    Dan Mahota, Emily Meuer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Instrument instrument 
      java.lang.String scale 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Melody(PApplet parent)
      Constructor for using Melody independently of an Input
      Melody(PApplet parent, Input input2)
      Constructor for use with an Input that allows the user to provide their Instrument of choice

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String[] getRangeList()
      Returns the list of possible range octave options as a String[]
      boolean isRunning() 
      void pause(boolean input)
      Used to pause or un-pause the Instrument; calls pauseNote(input) on the Instrument instance variable.
      Instrument playMelody(java.lang.String key, float bpm, java.lang.String scale, int rangeOctave)
      Calls the other playMelody with the Instrument instance variable, instead of requiring one from the user.
      void playMelody(java.lang.String key, float bpm, java.lang.String scale, int rangeOctave, Instrument instrument)
      Sets the instance variables with the same names to the values of the parameters, then starts the thread that will send them to the playMelodyThread method.
      void run() 
      void setBPM(int bpm) 
      void setKey(java.lang.String newKey)
      Setter for the key instance variable, which needs to be updated to give an accurate range.
      void setRangeList()
      Sets the rangeList instance variable with the high and low note of the current melody in each available octave.
      void setScale(java.lang.String newScale)
      Setter for the scale instance variable, which needs to be updated to make rangeList accurate when the Driver changes the scale.
      void stop()
      Stops the Instrument instance variable by calling stopNote() on it and sets the melodyThreadRunning boolean instance var to false.

        public Melody(PApplet parent)
        Constructor for using Melody independently of an Input
        Parameters:

      • Melody

        public Melody(PApplet parent,
              Input input2)
        Constructor for use with an Input that allows the user to provide their Instrument of choice
        Parameters:
        parent - PApplet for this sketch
        input2 - Input that will use the frequencies generated by playMelody()

    • Method Detail

      • playMelody

        public Instrument playMelody(java.lang.String key,
                             float bpm,
                             java.lang.String scale,
                             int rangeOctave)
        Calls the other playMelody with the Instrument instance variable, instead of requiring one from the user.
        Parameters:
        key - String denoting the current key; do not include major or minor designation here
        bpm - tempo in beats per minute
        scale - either the String "major", "minor", or "chromatic"
        rangeOctave - int giving the range octave

      • playMelody

        public void playMelody(java.lang.String key,
                       float bpm,
                       java.lang.String scale,
                       int rangeOctave,
                       Instrument instrument)
        Sets the instance variables with the same names to the values of the parameters, then starts the thread that will send them to the playMelodyThread method.
        Parameters:
        key - String denoting the current key; do not include major or minor designation here
        bpm - tempo in beats per minute
        scale - either the String "major", "minor", or "chromatic"
        rangeOctave - int giving the range octave; must be between 3 and 6
        instrument - Instrument that will play the Melody

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the Instrument instance variable by calling stopNote() on it and sets the melodyThreadRunning boolean instance var to false.

      • pause

        public void pause(boolean input)
        Used to pause or un-pause the Instrument; calls pauseNote(input) on the Instrument instance variable.
        Parameters:
        input - boolean indicating whether to pause or start the Instrument

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()

      • setRangeList

        public void setRangeList()
        Sets the rangeList instance variable with the high and low note of the current melody in each available octave.
        Parameters:
        keyPos - position of the current key in the key array - C is 0, C#/Bb are 1, etc.

      • getRangeList

        public java.lang.String[] getRangeList()
        Returns the list of possible range octave options as a String[]
        Returns:
        rangeList instance variable

      • setKey

        public void setKey(java.lang.String newKey)
        Setter for the key instance variable, which needs to be updated to give an accurate range.
        Parameters:
        newKey -

      • setScale

        public void setScale(java.lang.String newScale)
        Setter for the scale instance variable, which needs to be updated to make rangeList accurate when the Driver changes the scale.
        Parameters:
        newScale - Either "major", "minor" or "chromatic"

      • setBPM

        public void setBPM(int bpm)

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
